tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE network_outages (
  id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  outage_start TIMESTAMP,
  outage_end TIMESTAMP,
  affected_service VARCHAR(255),
  outage_description TEXT
);

CREATE TABLE network_outages (
  outage_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  location VARCHAR(255),
  outage_start TIMESTAMP,
  outage_end TIMESTAMP,
  description TEXT
)

CREATE TABLE disruption_reports (
  report_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  outage_id INT,
  reporter_name VARCHAR(100),
  report_description TEXT,
  reported_at TIMESTAMP,
  FOREIGN KEY (outage_id) REFERENCES network_outages(outage_id)
)

CREATE TABLE resolution_actions (
  action_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  outage_id INT,
  technician_name VARCHAR(100),
  action_description TEXT,
  resolved_at TIMESTAMP,
  FOREIGN KEY (outage_id) REFERENCES network_outages(outage_id)
)

CREATE TABLE network_outages (
  id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
  start_time TIMESTAMP,
  end_time TIMESTAMP,
  description TEXT,
  resolved BOOLEAN
);

CREATE TABLE network_devices (
  id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
  device_name VARCHAR(255),
  device_type VARCHAR(50),
  location VARCHAR(100),
  installation_date DATE
);

CREATE TABLE network_outages (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    outage_date DATE,
    outage_time TIME,
    duration INT,
    affected_service VARCHAR(255),
    reason TEXT
);

CREATE TABLE service_disruptions (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    disruption_date DATE,
    disruption_time TIME,
    duration INT,
    affected_service VARCHAR(255),
    reason TEXT
);

CREATE TABLE incident_reports (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    report_date DATE,
    report_time TIME,
    reported_by VARCHAR(255),
    description TEXT
);

CREATE TABLE service_providers (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    provider_name VARCHAR(255),
    contact_person VARCHAR(255),
    contact_email VARCHAR(255),
    contact_phone VARCHAR(15)
);
